H0.text: The ability to store water is the plant characteristic that most likely helps it live in a desert, an ecosystem that Brian knows receives less rain than other ecosystems yet still supports plant life.

H1.text: The ability to attract insects is the characteristic of a plant that most likely helps it live in a desert, an ecosystem that receives less rain than other ecosystems yet supports plant survival.

H2.text: The ability to stop predators is the characteristic of a plant that most likely helps it live in a desert, given that deserts receive less rain than other ecosystems yet plants can survive there.

H3.text: The ability to drop its leaves is the characteristic of a plant that most likely helps it live in a desert, where deserts receive less rain than other ecosystems yet plants can still survive.

A4.text: Succulents may store water in various structures, such as leaves and stems.

A5.text: Succulents are characterized by their ability to thrive on limited water sources, such as mist and dew, which makes them equipped to survive in ecosystems that contain scarce water sources.
